Description: Light-coloured pottery jug decorated on body with deep fluted incisions, raised bands on the neck, handle from shoulder to neck. Pale buff fabric and white slip. Common white inclusions and well rounded quartz, with grey core. Some dark inclusions and red-brown grog fragments. Marl fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Mercer Art Gallery, Harrogate. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

5th to 7th century AD parallel from Abu Mina, also in an Abu Mina fabric (Abd El-Aziz Negm, 1998, 71, fig. 11). Abd El-Aziz Negm, M. 1998. Recent excavations around Abou Mina, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 65-73.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.23) (Phase 3)
